intro: Eleocharis sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenis sedge, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, thriving in moist to aquatic environments. Its slender, cylindrical stems are usually unbranched, and it produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Eleocharis sintenisii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
